meanings.definition: Yagis (noun): a type of antenna used in radio communication.
meanings.sent1: The yagis on the roof help us receive radio signals clearly.
meanings.sent2: I learned how to set up the yagis for better radio reception.
meanings.sent3: The yagis at the station were so big, they looked like giant spiders!
meanings.sent4: His yagis reached out like a spider's legs, catching all the radio waves.
meanings.sent5: The yagis stood tall and proud, capturing the invisible messages from the air.

meanings.definition: Yagis (verb): the act of using a yagis antenna for communication.
meanings.sent1: We yagis to talk to people far away using radio waves.
meanings.sent2: He yagis every day to stay in touch with his friends.
meanings.sent3: I yagis with aliens using my special antenna!
meanings.sent4: She yagis like a pro, connecting with others effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Yagising through the airwaves, our messages travel at the speed of light.

meanings.definition: Yagis (adjective): describing something related to or characteristic of yagis antennas.
meanings.sent1: The yagis technology is fascinating and complex.
meanings.sent2: She studied the yagis design to improve its efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The yagis workshop was filled with innovative ideas.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a yagis maze of radio frequencies and signals.
meanings.sent5: The yagis innovation revolutionized the way we communicate wirelessly.
